channel.title: Compiler issue for 667/702 MezzyScape!
channel.description:
Is my compiler code correct? Cause i get the errors which are stated below this code... Here's my compiler code:
[code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" -classpath
bin\com\rs\ -cp src\com\rs\cache\*.java src\com\rs\*.java
src\com\rs\cache\loaders\*.java src\com\rs\game\*.java
src\com\rs\game\item\*.java src\com\rs\game\npc\*.java
src\com\rs\game\npc\combat\*.java
src\com\rs\game\npc\combat\impl\*.java src\com\rs\game\tasks\*.java
src\com\rs\game\minigames\*.java src\com\rs\game\player\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\actions\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\content\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\content\dungeoneering\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\content\dungeoneering\rooms\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\controlers\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\cutscenes\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\cutscenes\actions\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\dialogues\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\quests\*.java
src\com\rs\game\player\quests\impl\*.java src\com\rs\game\tasks\*.java
src\com\rs\io\*.java src\com\rs\net\*.java
src\com\rs\net\encoders\*.java src\com\rs\net\decoders\*.java
src\com\rs\net\decoders\handlers\*.java src\com\rs\tools\*.java
src\com\rs\utils\*.java src\com\rs\utils\huffman\*.java pause[/code]
Made it myself... wasn't sure if it's correct or not.. a little shabby with .bat coding.. but I get 100 errors when I compile. Am I doing something wrong in the .bat? Or is this source completely screwed up from the start? I get errors similar to:
[code]symbol : class Familiar location: class com.rs.game.player.Player public void setFamiliar(Familiar familiar) { ^ src\com\rs\game\minigames\War.java:7: package com.rs.cores does not exist import com.rs.cores.CoresManager; ^ src\com\rs\game\npc\NPC.java:9: cannot find symbol symbol : class Cache location: package com.rs.cache import com.rs.cache.Cache; ^ src\com\rs\game\npc\NPC.java:11: package com.rs.cores does not exist import com.rs.cores.CoresManager; ^ src\com\rs\game\npc\NPC.java:22: package com.rs.game.npc.familiar does not exist
import com.rs.game.npc.familiar.Familiar; ^ src\com\rs\net\Session.java:23: cannot find symbol symbol : class Channel location: class com.rs.net.Session private Channel channel; ^ src\com\rs\net\Session.java:27: cannot find symbol symbol : class Channel location: class com.rs.net.Session public Session(Channel channel) { ^ src\com\rs\net\Session.java:36: cannot find symbol symbol : class ChannelFuture location: class com.rs.net.Session public final ChannelFuture write(OutputStream outStream) { ^ src\com\rs\net\Session.java:47: cannot find symbol symbol : class ChannelBuffer location: class com.rs.net.Session public final ChannelFuture write(ChannelBuffer outStream) { ^ src\com\rs\net\Session.java:47: cannot find symbol symbol : class ChannelFuture location: class com.rs.net.Session public final ChannelFuture write(ChannelBuffer outStream) { ^[/code]
Please tell me how to fix this issue, thanks in advice.

item.title: Compiler issue for 667/702 MezzyScape!
item.dc:creator: @EclipseRSPS EclipseRSPS
item.description:
@EclipseRSPS wrote:

[quote=“skiller8860, post:9, topic:435477”]Where may I contact Matrix? :o…

EDIT:
Why when I compile the client i get like… no joke 100 errors :L…

Here’s my client compiler code:

[code]@echo off
“C:/Program Files/java/jdk1.7.0_03/bin/javac” -d bin -cp lib/libs.jar:lib/graphics.jar src/*.java

pause[/code][/quote]

Has nothing to do with the Compiler Code.
The client is shitty + it’s backdoored.
It contains code that can shutdown your pc.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue for 667/702 MezzyScape!
item.dc:creator: @EclipseRSPS EclipseRSPS
item.description:
@EclipseRSPS wrote:

[quote=“skiller8860, post:7, topic:435477”][quote author=EclipseRSPS link=topic=538198.msg3937361#msg3937361 date=1331151026]
This is NOT MEZZYSCAPE.
He just re-released someone else’s work that wasn’t supposed to be released in the first place.
It was a leak of Matrix.

Under no circumstances can Mezzy claim even .01% credit for this source in any way.
[/quote]

I appolagize for my misunderstanding, sorry. Didn’t know it was a leak of Matrix. Thanks for informing me :).

Still… anyone know how to fix this? :S This is a really nice/lovely source I would like to use… and keep developing on and make it look better.

Did you portforward, if yes, can i help coding it and be owner ;)?

@Topic

@echo off title Compiler ~poepen112 echo starting... "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe" -classpath ./lib/mysql.jar;./lib/FileStore.jar;./lib/netty-3.2.6.Final.jar; -d bin src/com/rs/*.java src/com/rs/cache/*.java src/com/rs/cache/loaders/*.java src/com/rs/cores/*.java src/com/rs/game/*.java src/com/rs/game/item/*.java src/com/rs/game/minigames/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/combat/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/combat/impl/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/corp/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/dragons/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/dungeonnering/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/familiar/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/bandos/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/barrows/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/saradomin/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/zammorak/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/zaros/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/kalph/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/others/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/slayer/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/actions/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/content/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/content/dungeoneering/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/content/dungeoneering/rooms/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/controlers/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/cutscenes/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/cutscenes/actions/*.java src/com/rs/game/player/dialogues/*.java src/com/rs/game/tasks/*.java src/com/rs/*.java src/com/rs/io/*.java src/com/rs/net/*.java src/com/rs/net/decoders/*.java src/com/rs/net/decoders/handlers/*.java src/com/rs/net/encoders/*.java src/com/rs/tools/*.java src/com/rs/utils/*.java src/com/rs/utils/huffman/*.java src/com/rs/game/npc/godwars/armadyl/*.java pause

I have this,

Thanks for helping me (:! I get no errors what so ever when compiling now :D. I’m completely glad you could help me. Help me code the server, sure why not? Just inbox me if you want to help me code ;). Cause I got a client compile.bat error too <_<… :L[/quote]

I would not recommend using this base without permission as Matrix will likely retaliate.
Also, Use the eclipse IDE, it’s much better than using a compiler <3

eclipse.org

Eclipse Downloads | The Eclipse Foundation

The Eclipse Foundation - home to a global community, the Eclipse IDE, Jakarta EE and over 350 open source projects, including runtimes, tools and frameworks.

item.title: Compiler issue for 667/702 MezzyScape!
item.dc:creator: @skiller8860 skiller8860
item.description:
@skiller8860 wrote:

Is my compiler code correct? Cause i get the errors which are stated below this code… Here’s my compiler code:

[code]@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe” -classpath

bin\com\rs\ -cp src\com\rs\cache*.java src\com\rs*.java

src\com\rs\cache\loaders*.java src\com\rs\game*.java

src\com\rs\game\item*.java src\com\rs\game\npc*.java

src\com\rs\game\npc\combat*.java

src\com\rs\game\npc\combat\impl*.java src\com\rs\game\tasks*.java

src\com\rs\game\minigames*.java src\com\rs\game\player*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\actions*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\content*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\content\dungeoneering*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\content\dungeoneering\rooms*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\controlers*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\cutscenes*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\cutscenes\actions*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\dialogues*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\quests*.java

src\com\rs\game\player\quests\impl*.java src\com\rs\game\tasks*.java

src\com\rs\io*.java src\com\rs\net*.java

src\com\rs\net\encoders*.java src\com\rs\net\decoders*.java

src\com\rs\net\decoders\handlers*.java src\com\rs\tools*.java

src\com\rs\utils*.java src\com\rs\utils\huffman*.java
pause[/code]

Made it myself… wasn’t sure if it’s correct or not… a little shabby with .bat coding… but I get 100 errors when I compile. Am I doing something wrong in the .bat? Or is this source completely screwed up from the start? I get errors similar to:

[code]symbol : class Familiar
location: class com.rs.game.player.Player
public void setFamiliar(Familiar familiar) {
^
src\com\rs\game\minigames\War.java:7: package com.rs.cores does not exist
import com.rs.cores.CoresManager;
^
src\com\rs\game\npc\NPC.java:9: cannot find symbol
symbol : class Cache
location: package com.rs.cache
import com.rs.cache.Cache;
^
src\com\rs\game\npc\NPC.java:11: package com.rs.cores does not exist
import com.rs.cores.CoresManager;
^
src\com\rs\game\npc\NPC.java:22: package com.rs.game.npc.familiar does not exist

import com.rs.game.npc.familiar.Familiar;
^
src\com\rs\net\Session.java:23: cannot find symbol
symbol : class Channel
location: class com.rs.net.Session
private Channel channel;
^
src\com\rs\net\Session.java:27: cannot find symbol
symbol : class Channel
location: class com.rs.net.Session
public Session(Channel channel) {
^
src\com\rs\net\Session.java:36: cannot find symbol
symbol : class ChannelFuture
location: class com.rs.net.Session
public final ChannelFuture write(OutputStream outStream) {
^
src\com\rs\net\Session.java:47: cannot find symbol
symbol : class ChannelBuffer
location: class com.rs.net.Session
public final ChannelFuture write(ChannelBuffer outStream) {
^
src\com\rs\net\Session.java:47: cannot find symbol
symbol : class ChannelFuture
location: class com.rs.net.Session
public final ChannelFuture write(ChannelBuffer outStream) {
^[/code]

Please tell me how to fix this issue, thanks in advice.

Read full topic
